headline: A second setup that earns its counter space.
subheadline: 58mm commercial group, PID control, and a thermoblock that's ready in 90 seconds. The Primo is the quick-draw machine for the barista who already owns the flagship.
hero_image_alt: Arco Primo espresso machine beside an Arco Zero grinder on a wooden workbench, a bottomless portafilter mid-extraction showing a perfect cone of espresso, an Arco Studio visible in the background of a well-equipped home coffee station
description_long: You already have the main rig dialed in. The Primo isn't here to replace it -- it's here for the Tuesday morning when you want a quick shot without warming up the dual boiler, or the guest setup when friends come over and you don't want them near your profiling machine. The 58mm group head takes the same commercial baskets and accessories you already own. PID-controlled temperature means the shots are respectable, not just convenient. And the thermoblock heat-up time means it's pulling shots while your main machine is still warming its boiler. For the price, it's the most useful second machine in the lineup.
use_case_headline: The weekday workhorse for your coffee station.
use_case_body: Same 58mm baskets as your main setup. PID-controlled thermoblock. 90-second ready time. The Primo gives you a credible shot without the 20-minute boiler warm-up -- perfect for mornings when speed matters more than profiling.

social_proof_quote.quote: I have a Studio Pro for the weekend sessions, but the Primo handles my weekday shots beautifully. Same baskets, same tamper, no warm-up wait. It's the best money I've spent on a second machine.
social_proof_quote.name: Luca R.
